content.rendered:
Photo via Unsplash

This Week in Genesis, StudioPress goes live, a new Genesis premium theme, and how to implement the WordPress theme logo support feature in Genesis.

Brian Gardner goes live

In case you missed it, it was the first ever episode of StudioPress Live this week featuring Brian Gardner taking questions for an hour over on Facebook Live.

Join me in one hour … LIVE on Facebook. Submit your questions now —> https://t.co/yHE1VY8yu0 #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/SIv6nlxpW3

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) February 16, 2017

If, like me, you weren’t able to catch it live though, don’t worry. You can replay the whole thing and hear an under the weather Brian tackle questions on a whole host of topics, including:

  • StudioPress Sites
  • the new StudioPress.blog site
  • StudioPress.fm
  • when the next Genesis child theme will be released over on StudioPress
  • using Genesis in your website’s domain name and more!

Brian also revealed that StudioPress plans to make these live videos a regular (weekly) event. Though that will most likely start a fortnight from now.

Themes

Amber Olson launches her new Ambre Noire theme for Genesis.

Introducing the Ambre Noire WordPress Theme. Designed for Lifestyle Bloggers. A Genesis child theme. https://t.co/Y7AqjYi4RI #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/OkIjnnHQXD

— Amber Olson (@ambrewebstudio) February 13, 2017

JT Grauke’s got another update / tease of his forthcoming Echo Pro theme for Genesis.

Echo Pro Front Page https://t.co/m6GslHdpoq #dribbble #genesiswp #ui #interface #landingpage #design @dribbble @studiopress

— JT Grauke (@jtgrauke) February 14, 2017

Popular Genesis theme shop ZigZagPress had a few downtime issues this week but are now back in business.

Frustrating week, but we're finally able to sell & support our #genesiswp themes again! Now for (more) coffee… https://t.co/9XeUDpTKgR

— Frank Barnett (@fbarnett) February 17, 2017

Showcase

Brian Gardner with a new design for his No Sidebar project.

Here’s what hours of late night obsessing over design and typography look like —> https://t.co/gOcIsdzbHo pic.twitter.com/fnlJUOHAsr

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) February 15, 2017

New photography site from Dan Rippon for howestudios.com.au

New #genesiswp showcase site from @danrippon https://t.co/G5HeyzgjHk pic.twitter.com/eHdchvl7uk

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) February 19, 2017

A wintry showcase site from CYBERsprout for core-ice.com

New on https://t.co/vUGfVo4c50, a wintry showcase site (based on Genesis Sample) from @CYBERsproutnet https://t.co/Oq3rSVVzJh pic.twitter.com/AdRQImpEfQ

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) February 13, 2017

Omar Al-Ansari launches a new multilingual site for prf.qa

Just launched a new Multi-language site for Thukerhttps://t.co/gsVvpZm1J4#WordPress #GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/r7D4jK0KvZ

— Omar Al-Ansari (@oalansari82) February 14, 2017

Eric Blosch with a new site for author Will Weaver, willweaverbooks.com

We just launched a new website for Minnesota-based author @will__weaver: https://t.co/oVMNLINksO #genesiswp #WordPress pic.twitter.com/4LS3JI7r93

— Eric Blosch (@ericblosch) February 13, 2017

Creative Visual Design for petersburgprovisions.com

New website for my friends at Petersburg Provisions. #rva #petersburg #webdesign #genesiswp @studiopress @bgardner https://t.co/3skhHqjxut pic.twitter.com/lpXOuKD7n4

— CreativeVisualDesign (@CreativeVisual) February 14, 2017

Lauren Gray for apinchofhealthy.com

Just launched a new site for @APinchOfHealthy on #genesiswp and #WordPress! Woohoo!

— Lauren Gray (@OnceCoupled) February 15, 2017

And, if you’d like to see a whole lot more showcase sites, check out this great showcase of Imagely’s photography themes for Genesis.

New on https://t.co/vUGfVo4c50, @imagely launches a new showcase section for all their Genesis photography themes! https://t.co/meV5RtIFHR

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) February 17, 2017

Best of the rest

How to implement the WordPress theme logo support feature in Genesis.

How to implement the Theme Logo support feature in Genesis:https://t.co/IKqxlkwiav#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/G3jN5mQbML

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) February 17, 2017

David Wang with a useful looking snippet for the Genesis developers out there.

Serve minified stylesheet when SCRIPT_DEBUG or WP_DEBUG is defined for #GenesisWP https://t.co/JWlYpeZrww

— David Wang (@blogjunkie) February 18, 2017

If you’re an affiliate – or just want to share some StudioPress love – check out the (brand?) new StudioPress brand assets page…

This just in—a brand assets page for you to use! 🙂

Check it out —> https://t.co/zly2t8nxFy pic.twitter.com/5YuuzkwwEJ

— StudioPress (@studiopress) February 14, 2017

…and speaking of branding, they’ve also updated the look of the StudioPress forums too.

Hey everyone. We just updated the design of our community forums. Here ya go —> https://t.co/bdsvDfitmb

— StudioPress (@studiopress) February 14, 2017

Jesse Petersen with a reminder that we all started somewhere…

A reminder to the #GenesisWP developers who look up to the established members of the community, we all started somewhere. Site from 2010: pic.twitter.com/z09O7Twgk8

— Jesse Ⓦ Petersen (@jpetersen) February 17, 2017

And if you’re looking to level up your Genesis skills you could do a lot worse than check out Tonya Mork’s excellent Know The Code site (with loads of free content on there too).

Want to do more with #GenesisWP? Let's gently ease you into the framework with this FREE hands-on lab https://t.co/EVwKLRAPCz

— Know The Code (@KnowTheCodePro) February 14, 2017

And finally…

Huge congrats to one of the most well known figures in the Genesis community, Sridhar Katakam, on becoming a dad!

I am a dad! pic.twitter.com/1gZk5lPuVI

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) February 19, 2017

—

That’s all for this week.

Want even more? Go follow us on Facebook or Twitter.

Want to share your awesome thing? Go register and add it to the homepage now!

Till next time, let’s keep Genesis awesome.
